Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\), governed by the differential equations \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\), where A and B are constant matrices. The system undergoes a Fourier transformation \\( F(z) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} e^{-i\\omega t}z(t) dt \\), which modifies its spectral components.

If an additional transformation \\( G(z) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} e^{Ct}z(t) dt \\) (where C is a constant matrix) is applied at time \\( t_1 \\), does the spectrum \\( F(z) \\) at time \\( t > t_1 \\) solely depend on the transformations by A and B?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( G(z) \\) introduces modifications to \\( z(t) \\) that also depend on C along with A and B. This adds complexity to the system's dynamics and affects its frequency-domain representation, hence \\( F(z) \\) at times after \\( t_1 \\) will reflect the influences of A, B, and C.
